articles.description: Douglas CARES, which provides critical medical and psychological exams for abused and neglected children, as well as counseling for them and their families, is shutting down for at least a month due to a funding shortage.
articles.title: Douglas CARES closing immediately

articles.author: Joseph Ziegler
articles.description: Douglas County commissioners will hold a Jan. 7 public hearing to consider forming the Winchester Ridge Domestic Water Supply District. The proposal would create a new water utility entity for residents in the unincorporated Winchester Ridge area.
articles.title: Douglas County Commissioners to Hold Public Hearing on Proposed Winchester Ridge Water District

articles.author: Joseph Ziegler
articles.description: After 10 years in Roseburg, Oran Mor Artisan Mead has closed its Roseburg tasting room following the relocation of its production closer to Portland. The company says it is not closing and will continue operating at its new location.
articles.title: Oran Mor Artisan Mead Closes Roseburg Tasting Room After 10 Years, Relocates Production Near Portland

articles.author: Joseph Ziegler
articles.description: Roseburg police responded to a reported stabbing near SE Pine Street Thursday morning where a 60-year-old man was found with a fatal stab wound. A juvenile suspect was later taken into custody. No further details have been released.
articles.title: Man Dies After Stabbing at “The Point” in Roseburg; Juvenile Taken Into Custody

articles.author: Joseph Ziegler
articles.description: Roseburg police reported multiple arrests on Jan. 1, including theft, criminal trespass, assault on an officer, and warrant cases. Several individuals were lodged at Douglas County Corrections following separate incidents across the city.
articles.title: Police Log - January 1, 2026

articles.author: Joseph Ziegler
articles.description: Oregon’s new 2026 waterway rules require nearly all paddlecraft: kayaks, SUPs, rafts, and more - to carry a Waterway Access Permit. Fees start at $6, with funds supporting access, safety, and invasive species prevention statewide.
articles.title: New Oregon Waterway Permit Requirements Take Effect in 2026

articles.title: January 2, 2026

articles.author: Joseph Ziegler
articles.description: Facing financial strain, Douglas C.A.R.E.S will temporarily pause operations beginning Jan. 1. The organization says the move is aimed at long-term sustainability while ensuring children continue to receive support through partner agencies.
articles.title: Douglas C.A.R.E.S to Temporarily Suspend Services Amid Funding Crisis

articles.author: Joseph Ziegler
articles.description: A Coos County man faces multiple felony charges, including murder and kidnapping, after a fatal shooting in Coos Bay. Police say the suspect disrupted his arraignment and is accused of killing a man in a Staples parking lot and threatening another victim.
articles.title: Coos County Man Arraigned on Murder, Kidnapping Charges After Courthouse Disruption

articles.author: Joseph Ziegler
articles.description: A Roseburg man faces multiple charges after allegedly breaking into a home and leaving behind his wallet at the scene. Police say the suspect fled before officers arrived but was later identified and jailed on burglary and theft charges.
articles.title: Wallet Left Behind Leads to Arrest in Roseburg Burglary Case

articles.description: Douglas CARES, the only Child Advocacy Center in Douglas County, is pausing operations starting Jan. 1 due to severe financial issues. This pause is expected to last until at least Feb.1.
